intro: Fagara pinnata, commonly known as the pinnate fagara, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are pinnately arranged with elongated, serrated leaflets. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have four or five petals. Fagara pinnata is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
